did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Notebooks of architectural class notes and drawings; student papers; notebooks and sketchbooks on gardens; photographs of gardens and parks; architectural drawings and renderings; pen and ink drawings; and articles on architectural topics.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Charles Downing Lay attended the School of Architecture at Columbia University from 1896 to 1900 and received a S.B. in Landscape Architecture from Harvard University's School of Landscape Architecture in 1902. From 1902 to 1948 he maintained a landscape architecture practice in New York City. He served as editor and publisher of Landscape Architecture with H. V. Hubbard and Robert Wheelwright. His projects included town planning for Albany, N.Y. and for the United States Housing Corporation in Erie and Butler, Pa.; parks in New York City, Troy, Albany, Schenectady, and Brooklyn, N.Y., Washington, D.C., and Stratford, Connecticut; school grounds in New York, Massachusetts, and Connecticut; subdivisions in New York, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, and New Jersey; and housing in New York City. He also was consulting architect to the 1939 New York World's Fair and worked on conservation efforts in the Housatonic River valley, founding the Housatonic Valley Planning Association in 1948.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Charles Downing Lay papers, #4477. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections: Oliver Ingraham Lay, Charles Downing Lay, and Lay family papers at the Archives of American Art, https://www.aaa.si.edu/collections/oliver-ingraham-lay-charles-downing-lay-and-lay-family-papers-6011.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Personal

Series II. Student Papers

Series III. Correspondence

Series IV. Art and Artists

Series V. Private Homes and Estates

Series VII. Writings

Series IX. Photographs and negatives of private homes, estates, public areas and other
Boxes 8-17

Series X. Oversize blueprints, sketches, drawings, paintings and photographs
Box 19; Mapcase Folder 1-13
